text: On tap at N√∏gne √ò, Zwanze Day. It pours an unclear deep candy red body under a small dark pink head leaving nice curtains. Lots of raspberry in the aroma, with a deep blueberry scent, lemony, leathery funk and a wee touch of vanilla. It¬ís sour and tart on the palate, full-bodied, surprisingly full-bodied for a lambic actually, with a pleasant carbonation level. Really smooth on the palate, even though it¬ís this sour. Leather, lemon and barnyard in the back, with raspberries dominating. Heavy blueberry flavor in the back, with a vanilla touch so weak I doubt I¬íd noticed if I didn¬ít know it was there. Eternal finish. A really fantastic beer, the blueberries really plays a significant role here. 161001
Bottle. Deep ruby purple color, pink head. Nice aroma of floral mixed forest berries, yogurt, dust. Taste is fruity, sour berries and lemon, tart finish. very tasty.

Zwanze day / N√∏gne √ò 2016. Deep red color with a pinkish/red head. Aroma is raspberries, blueberries, yeast, funk. flavor is raspberries, blueberries, vanilla, yeast, funk, wood, lemon. Very nice beer.
On tap. Ruby colour with pink head. Fruit, raspberry aroma. Fruit, raspberry, acidic, sour and slightly sweet taste. Medium body.

On tap @Ma che siete venuti a f√† (Rome). Bellissimo rubino sangue di piccione con riflessi porpora, schiuma rosata media, molto persistente. Naso pulitissimo, meraviglioso aroma di lamponi, more, mirtilli, leggera nota di vaniglia appena percepibile. In bocca √® magnificamente bilanciata, complessa, mediamente acida, fruttata e fresca, irrobustita con note di vaniglia e una dolcezza bilanciata che la rendono incredibilmente elegante e ruffiana. Corpo medio, carbonazione leggera. Raffinatissima!

Bottle at source. Almost creamy intensely pink burgundy head, dark ruby red color. Intense aroma of berries and berry seeds of raspberris and somewhat not yet ripe blueberries. Only slightest notes of the vanilla lambic (which in itself is amazing), but then agaim it is used to build the backbone and not flavor itself. Nice mouthfeel and flavors have a better and more clear mix of raspberries and blueberries. Not too funky, balanced sourness and gentle tartness at the end. Drink it fresh.
Draft: Poured a maroon and pink head. Aroma was nice fruit berry. Tart pungent fruit raspberry and cherry. Sour through with a nice soft finish.

(Cantillon Zwanze (2016) Framboise) Tap at Butcher¬ís Tears, Amsterdam during Zwanze Day.
Deep red ruby colour on the body, mostly clear, with a good sized pink head on top, good retention too.
Aroma of berries, wood, light funk character.
Taste is nicely sour, with berries, funk, grass, wood.
Medium body with good carbonation.
Very good!

Zwanze 16 drank at the scource on 161119

Pours ruby red with a purple note and a fluffy, bright pink head.

Smells of old wood and a light funkiness which gets overruled by ripe, sweet raspberries, which got the most jammy quality I have so far experienced in a Cantillon Lambic. Scented wood with a nice vanilla nuance mingles into a stone fruit earthiness, creating a very intriguing fruit composition. 

Soft on the tongue with a fitting carbonation, adding a nice crispness to the fruits, while the mouthfeel maintains its silkness throughout. Easy drinking with a sweetness, which gets almost matched by the berry tartness.

On the taste, the beer starts with raspberries, initially not unlike the Ros√© de Gambrinus, until it gets accompanied by flowery sweet vanilla, finding a well fitting interaction in the old oak, which creates a soft rusticness. This revolts against the refreshing fruit acidity, evolving from a stone pit earthiness with raspberry jam on top. It finishes with a dominating, yet pleasant fruitiness which has by now overcome its wooden antagonist for the most part, while its lively tartness maintains the ability to cut through. 

Overall I don¬ít think the vanilla addition is overly substantial, it almost prevents the beer from developing its usual complexity, since it cuts off the oak to a certain degree, replacing it by a unneccesary sweetness. Don¬ít get me wrong, its sweetness is never coming close to being artificial on the tongue, it just does not provide the greatness of the Ros√© (which, to be fair, is one of my all time favourites).
Bottle at Cantillon. Pours red color, pinky head. Aroma of blueberries, cherries. Taste is sour, cherries, blueberries, vanilla.

Draft sample at Cantillon Zwanze day event at Butchers Tears Amsterdam, The Netherlands. 01.10.2016. THANK YOU KEVIN FOR THIS SAMPLE. Pour it dark red color with almost no head. Aroma funky straw, raspberries, and really pinch of vanilla. Taste nice smooth tart feel, raspberry juice, some cherry kind of a feel, basement aromas, vanilla just a hint, nice smooth texture, slick feel, lively, astringent. Nice!

from bottle at the brewery, poured a deep purple colour with a pink head. nose is big raspberry forward, barnyard funk, tartness from the blueberry, the small amount of vanilla makes it a touch sweeter from the tart fruits, tart raspberries, tart cantillon funk aftertaste, and light citrus. delicious tart fruits. but side to a gambrinus or lpf it¬ís not very special imo

Draught @ Zwanze Day 2016 - N√∏gne √ò, Grimstad
Pours slightly hazy deep red with a pink head. Aroma is tart with notes of malt, brett, raspberries, bllueberries and a hint of vanilla. Taste is medium sweet and medium sour with a long dry, raspberry, blueberry, tart, brett and hint of vanilla finish. Body is medium, texture is thin to oily, carbonation is soft.

UPDATED: NOV 11, 2016 03-11-16 // 750ml bottle shared at Cantillon brewery, Brussels. Wow. Just wow. This beer pours a light hazy beer with a deep pinish red colour. Solid head. Nose is lamibc sourness paired with some rasperry fruitiness. Taste of a perfect lamic. Sour and tart. Funky. Light earthiness. Fresh rasperries along with light blueberrie notes (cant taste blueberry, but theres more fruit than rasperry, and its obviously blueberries). And in the end there is indeed a light vanilla spicyness. Perfect!
Fƒæa¬öa v pivovare. Tmavo ru¬ûov√° farba, biela pena. V√¥≈àa ƒçuƒçoriedok, ƒçern√≠c, jemn√° sladkos≈•. Kyselkav√© v chuti, sladkos≈• jemn√° po vanilke, ƒçuƒçoriedky, ƒçernice.

Bottle at the brewery. Great complexity, intensity and richness of flavours. Lots of fruitiness, berries, just a touch of vanilla. Moderate sourness with delicate lactic character. Very easy to drink, tasty, flavourful. Great one.
Bottle at brewery.  Ruby color with small pinkish head. Aroma of raspberries, bluberries, vanilla. Sour taste with raspberries, blueberries, vanilla, marzipan, wood. Tasty.
Bottle at Cantillon. (20 eur) Deep red with a small head. Fresh with raspberries, wood, funk and light vanilla. Elegant and nicely drinkable. A tasty one that was not that sour.

Reviewed from notes. Sampled at Zwanze Day at West Lakeview. Pours a deep red/almost purple color with just small amount of pink head. The nose is comprised mainly of seedy raspberry with maybe a touch of blueberry. I didnt really detect any vanilla on the nose or in the taste. The flavor was heavily reminiscent of RdG, there was jammy raspberry character accompanied by a healthy amount of funkiness. The blueberry was all but lost in the taste though IMO. Light mouthfeel, pleasant acidity, lively carbonation, and soft, dry finish. This was a nice beer, but didn¬ít really differentiate itself much from the RdG we tried earlier that day.

1st October 2016Keg at the Kernel Zwanze event. Here we go then - light haze on this purplish red beer, tidy and bubbly pink head. Palate is light, semi dry and has fine minerally crispness. Tangy fruits that develop a little acid. Good blueberry, seems to dominate the raspberry which is just part of a generic berry fruit undertone. Some berry jam. Tangy lemony finish. Yeah it¬ís nicely fruity, simple but fruity but after a glass it starts to burn a little and thus fatigue sets in pretty quickly. Pleasant, but as usual, vastly overrated!

Pours dark Red, small pink head. Smell is pure raspberry, in a very natural way. Vanilla undertone that Pairs perfectly. Taste is sour, lambicfunk, typical Cantillon Wood , funk, and dryness. Very aromatic raspberry. Reminding of the best batches of rdg. Vanilla is very hidden. A great raspberry sour ! Unfortunately, i had expected a big blast, but -especizlly in taste - this beers lacks the true unique character. I¬íd be equally happy with a good batch of ros√© de gambrinus, only that this Costs a lot more . perhaps Ith more vanilla, this Would have been a true gem to me ( as the scent provides ) now its a great beer, but with provided alternatives from the very same brewery .
Zwanze day 2016. Deep red. Minimal head with nothing overly noticeable. Raspberry and blueberry come through with tart notes and a mild sweetness.

From notes. This was enjoyed at Jolly Pumpkin on October 1 for Zwanze Day 2016! The big fella! The pour is a dark ruby with a thick pink/light purple head that slowly falls down, leaving a couple spots of lace behind. The aroma is very heavily jammy with the raspberries and blueberries. Damn. It¬ís a good mash, that¬ís for sure. The vanilla is very light and faint on the nose. The flavor is a lot more funky than the nose would lead on. The jamminess is still there, but it¬ís just really funky over tart and sharp. The balance is actually pretty good. The mouth feel is a little thicker than I want it to be with a brighter carbonation and a lingeringly funky and sweet raspberry and blueberry jam. I¬ím actually glad the vanilla wasn¬ít more intense, because that could¬íve made it a mess. Good beer.

Draft @ Himmeriget, Copenhagen. Pours a dark red color with a small white head. Has a fruity sour raspberry aroma. Fruity sour tart raspberry flavor with weak hints of vanilla. Has a fruity sour tart raspberry vanilla finish.

Bottle consumed on the Eurostar, 14th October 16. Pours a pretty deep pink, slight haze, little or no head, aroma is berry, funk. Taste is rich, tart raspberry, there is some more sour blueberry identifiable, it¬ís smooth, sour, slight acidic, with a vanilla linger on the finish. Very tasty and very moorish, I think the chap next to me on the train thought I was necking a full bottle of wine :)

Tap @ Himmeriget, Copenhagen Zwanze day 20161001. Fruity and light funky, light acidic, berries like raspberries, strawberries and blueberries, light vanilla notes, medium body with an oily texture. The finish is dry with vanilla.

Bottle shared at cantillon! Pours a bright reddish pink with bubbly pink white head that dissipates slowly. Aroma of huge raspberry notes with a subtle lingering funk and acidity. Taste follows, the raspberry is way bigger than the rose. Pleasant acidity, mild funk, soft carbonation, awesome.
Bottle at Cantillon. Clear deep red with pink head. Aroma of vanilla, a lot of raspberries and barnyard. Taste is tart sour, lots of raspberries, well balanced, dry bitter finish.

Sampled at N√∏gne √ò/Zwanze 2016. Beautiful looking with a deep red body under a small pink head. Aroma has acidic berries with raspberries, blueberries and a light hint of wood/vanilla. Flavor is acidic with fruit as aroma and funky barnyard. Fine balanced body and long lasting aftertaste with fruit and acid. Sure very nice even if I¬ím not the biggest fan of fruity lambics.

Tap @ Himmeriget at Zwanze Day 2016. Pours deep vivid red with a medium pinkish head. Aroma has lots of raspberries, classic young Cantillon funk, some vinegary notes, tannins, cheese. Taste is first and foremost framboise-like, hitting some leathery tannins thereafter, blueberry jam, wet grass, vinegar, subtle vanilla in the backend.

Zwanze day, Brisbane, Scratch Bar. Deep red pour. Aroma is a nice blend of funk and fruit - fruit is absolutely popping. Taste is berries galore, especially the raspberries. Not getting much of the old blueies. Sour is more restrained. Acid fruits. Nice but reckon it will be way better in a couple of years.

On tap at Stadin Panimo. Ruby red, bordeaux red colour. Nice, pinkish head. Definitely needed some warming after serving. Still blueberries, raspberries and also vanilla were present in the aroma. After warming the freshness of the berries came up more intensly and other nuances of the lambic were there as well. Raspberries, blueberries at first. Slightly salty in the middle. Acidic notes and hints of vanilla and berries again in the end. Vinegar and hints of vanilla in the aftertaste. Interesting, pleseant combination of the taste. Light, but at the same time full-bodied brew. Berryful and juicy palate. Very well balanced beer. Really nice.

Tap @ Himmeriget, Copenhagen. Deep deep red pour with a off white head with pinkish hues. Notes of juicy berries, sweet raspberries, tannins, some apple, musty funk, light blueberries and some faint vanilla.

On draft at The Sovereign for Zwanze Day.

Dark ruby body with a small collar. Raspberry leaps out in the aroma. The raspberry character is dominant, overpowering the blueberries. Perhaps a mild sweet note from the vanilla. While delicious, I found this one dimensional.

A quite delicious beer, however the raspberries lack the jammy richness of Rose de Gambrinus and the vanilla and blueberries are nigh-undetectable at best. So it¬ís a damn good beer because, well, Cantillon fruit lambic, but it¬ís not a world-beater.

Draft pour at Thin Man¬ís 2016 Zwanze Day. Poured a rich hazy plum and reddish color, small off white head. Aroma was tons of berry, straw, tart, funk. Flavor followed the nose with lots of berry presence, straw, a tart bite, and the vanilla is super subtle and barely noticed. Light body, sticky texture, soft minor carbonation, tart and dry finish. Outstanding.

On tap at Crooked Stave Barrel Cellar poured a clear ruby with a small lasting pink head. Aromas of raspberry, straw, blueberry, yeast and light barnyard funk. Palate was light bodied and crisp with a dry tart finish. Flavors of straw, raspberry, blueberry and light funk with a crisp dry tart lingering funky berry finish.

Bottle shared at the Brewery. Thanks Vincent! Fresh intense nose. Lots of raspberries and a few cherries. The vanilla is only there in the aftertaste, round, but the Cantillon funkiness is too high. The beer is intense fruity, but more on the sourish side. Fantastic fresh red fruit, horse blanket and smooth raspberry vanilla in the aftertaste. Great though.

On tap at Playalinda. Bright red with a pink head. Smells of raspberry and something that could be blueberry. I never get a very distinct blueberry flavor out of lambics anyway. Maybe vanilla. Something is softening the acidity. Tastes more of the berry flavor. The raspberry lends a lot sourness. Again, the vanilla seems to just soften the sourness more than taste of clear vanilla. Maybe I just can¬ít taste it. Back end is dry and oaky. Light body. Very tasty. I¬ím always happy when Zwanze is a fruit lambic.

Keg from the Kernel event. Big thanks to The_Osprey! Pours a rather fetching clear purple-red with a few bubbles forming the head. Pleasant ripe, almost rotten tart raspberry aroma, with a little old wood and grass. Light sweet flavour with sturdy but not overbearing acidity, some tangy raspberry, ample woody dryness, some under-ripe banana. Light bodied with soft carbonation. Bone dry on the finish, with further raspberry notes, moderate acidic bite, some musty notes, more drying woody aspect. Good stuff overall.

On tap @ The Kernel Brewery for Zwanze day 2016, London - UK. Color: deep purple beer with no carbonation and small non-persistent white foam. Smell: red fruits domination, tart and typical sourness. Raspberry and blueberry. Taste: medium body with tart attack. Very high acidity, fruity balance with red fruits domination as raspberry and blueberry. Really good balance. Astringent finish. Vanilla, and vanilla sugar. Quiet sweet finish. Aftertaste: red fruits notes, vanilla and vanilla sugar. Tart and astringent sourness.

Tap. Clear red body with a small pinkish head. Aroma of red berries, blueberries, brett and a hint of vanilla. Slightly sweet flavor that ends up being dry and tart. Light to medium bodied, watery to oily texture and soft carbonation. A very nice Lambic indeed. üåüüåüüåüüåü

Tasted multiple times at Rose Red in Bruges during Zwanze Day; this year¬ís edition honors the raspberry lambic Cantillon made back in the day when vanilla extract was added to soften the acidity, but upping the ante with added blueberries, and the vanilla extract has been replaced by real vanilla - clearly Cantillon can afford more now that craft beer culture has turned them into a world star... Thick and frothy, thickly lacing, off-pinkish head over a hazy, deep ruby red beer with even somewhat purplish hue. Aroma heavily emphasizes the fruit, with all kinds of things going on: a ton of red raspberries and indeed a hint of spicy blueberries, green tomato, sour yoghurt, stale sweat funkiness, wry grape peel, wet wood, sweet sherry, blackcurrant, clove-like spicy accent, red lambrusco, raw celery, very faint vanilla. Estery onset, acidity of unripe stonefruit and lemon but fairly soft for a Cantillon and not too puckering, overwhelming richness of red raspberries, lightly spicy blueberries clearly present (I guess reminiscent of the famous Blabaer, which I haven¬ít had yet), drying tartness throughout, lovely lactic sourness, soft bready and wheaty core underneath, thick layers of lambic funkiness in the end with a leathery Brett effect mixing well with the loads of berry juiciness and tartness, delicate vanilla shows up all the way at the back retronasally and blends with the oaky woody touch, yoghurty lactic sourness gets the last word and dries the finish, yeasty touch too and very faintly earthy but in all still relatively clean. Masterpiece, extremely rich in fruits, complex with all the components in perfect balance. World class fruit lambic without a doubt.

UPDATED: OCT 3, 2016 Tap @ Himmeriget, Copenhagen 1/10-16 (Zwanze day). Fruity with brett, cherries and blueberries, also acidic. Body is medium, the finish is dry and fruity with cherries, blueberries and some notes of vanilla.

Enjoyed courtesy of seymour, the pub in Greenfield, MA with friends from all over the northeast. The most relaxed Zwanze celebration yet, to be sure! Tastiest zwanze in recent memory as well, strong blueberry presence and a rush of vanillin on the front end.. Almost a seltzer like effervescence, deep color with blue/ maroon hue and bubbles that kept on coming. Would love to have another crack at this after it mellows for about a year in a bottle.

Draft. Blood red, 2 finger pink head faded to a thin line of red. The aroma is very raw, like a fruit salad. Flavor. Intense raspberry but very sweet. It¬ís sugary sweet with a frozen raspberry sort of flavor kind of watered down or like you¬íd get in a frozen area of a grocery store for smoothies. Nice tartness. Thin, finish is lingering sugar and raspberry.

De tirador a la Masia Agullons durant el Zwanze Day 2016. Cervesa color vermell intens amb escuma un punt rosada. Aromes de fruits vermells, especiats i un puntet de vainilla. Entrada dol√ßa amb final √†cid. Molt bona.

Draft @ ML Fontainas, Zwanze day 2016.
Couleur acajou - pourpre au col cr√©meux ros√¢tre.
Ar√¥me au nez tr√®s bien fruit√© oscillant evrs une bonne base de Gambrinus. Le tout sous couvert de fines effluves de myrtilles qui viennent compl√©ter le c√¥t√© aigrelet de la framboise. La vanille est tr√®s fine et arrive juste en rertait assez que pour donner un souffl√© adouci assez plaisant sans devenir surfait.
Palais est terreux, framboise gardant le profil terreux de fruit, astringence et fine aigreur avec un carcat√®re r√¢peux et p√©tillant en bouche.
Les myrtilles sont bien l√† en couvert des framboises. La douceur de vanille reste minime et ajoute juste ce qu¬íil faut de douceur √† la framboise sans jamais la supplanter.

On tap @ Zwanze Day 2016. Dark red with medium pinkish head. Good retention. Tart, raspberry, funk and light lemon in the aroma. Average carbonation and medium body. Taste is tart with strong raspberry notes. Light vanilla notes. Overall, a good beer.

Zwanze Day at Crooked Stave. Bright red color, with a small, beige head. Brilliant raspberry aroma, with a smooth cream, and a light lemon bite. Sweet and fruity, tart and sour, but smooth and pleasant. Medium body, acidic, silky, and clean. This is a lovely, fruity lambic. Crisp, clean, refreshing and delicious.

5oz draft in a goblet at The Sovereign on Zwanze Day 2016. Dark red with small pinkish head. Tart berries with lite wood, hint of vanilla (likely only because I was looking for it), some acidic citrus and yeast. Nice, but would improve with age.

On tap at Jester King Zwanze Day celebration. Pours a clear light red color with minimal very pink head. Raspberries, cherries, vanilla, blueberries, plenty of berry on the nose along with some tartness and funk; follows onto the palate. Light and crisp. Finishes with plenty of nice berry flavors complimented by a subtle sweetness from the vanilla and ends with the tartness of the lambic. Very well done.

on tap at Thin Man in Buffalo. the pour is beautiful. the color just pops. the nose has some lemon, and funk but kinda subdued. flavour is more blueberry then i expected. this was not a bad thing. really enjoyed this version.

Tap at Akkurat, Zwanze day. Pours deep purple with solid, pinkish head. Aroma is big on foremost raspberry and blueberry with some light citrus, very light funk. No smell of vanilla at all. Taste is similar with a surprising blueberry presence. It almost tastes more blueberries than bl√•baer. Beneath the slightly tart berries there are some very light oaky vanilla notes, hay and light barnyard. Finishes tart and dry with some light acidic lemon zest. Really tasty but not as complex as I expected.

Draft sample at Holy Grale during Zwanze 2016. The beer was poured into a small white wine style glass. The beer is a deep purple with a pink head of foam. Good retention. The aroma has great raspberry notes. Blueberry comes through as well, but don¬ít get vanilla. The taste is more one dimensional. Dry, floral sourness in the taste. Very sour. I wish the fruit came through more. Medium body and moderate carbonation. All around, this beer is pretty damn good, but this time the experience outdid the beer itself. Holy Grale is an awesome place, and they put on a hell of a time with this event.

Keg at Mother Arch, Zwanze Day, 01/10/16.
Reddish purple with a solid crimson cap.
Nose is tangy blueberry, straw, lemon drizzle, funky raspberry, barnyard, grains, grape must.
Taste comprises soured raspberries, funk, balsa wood, lemon rind, red grape must, oak, damp cloth, hay bale, jam pips. 
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, drying close with a moderate acidic lick. 
Super solid well balanced lambic, crisp, clean and delivers well on the berry promise.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Hazy ruby red color with pink head. Aroma has lots of raspberries buy you also get the subtle vanilla sweetness. Really fresh and fruity. Taste starts with raspberry jam, tart, unripe fruits and continues with some light funk, but quite clean overall. It really makes the fruits shine. Finishes tart and quite dry. A really tasty and aromatic fruity lambic.
Tap at Zwanze Day 2016 in Elkader, IA. Brilliant reddish purple pour with a pink head - gorgeous pour. Raspberry and blueberry aroma and taste. Somewhat tart and dry. Very good.

Hazy deep red with a small pinkish head. Aroma had plenty of raspberries and hints of vanilla. Flavor had raspberries, blueberry and hints of vanilla. Sour but not overly so line most Cantillons. Lovely balance. High drinkability. Good stuff!
From tap. Pours clear red. Smooth fruity. Light watery. Mild fruity. Crisp fruity. Medium dry. Mellow and fruity finish. Dry and mild finish.

Fat p√• Zwanze Day, Akkurat, Stockholm. Vilken k√§nsla att vara d√§r vid sl√§ppet! Appl√•der brister ut n√§r klockorna ringer. Litet glas, ca 10 cl. Knallr√∂d med litet rosa skum. H√§rligt friska och syrliga toner av hallon i b√•de doft och smak. Rena smaker, perfekt balanserad kropp, lagom torr och lagom stor syra. Fina stalltoner i eftersmaken. Hallonen √§r i f√∂rgrunden, √§ven om vaniljen och bl√•b√§ren finns med i smakbilden. Borde j√§mf√∂ra med Ros√© de Gambrinus.

Keg at Zwanze 2016, Kernel, Bermondsey. It pours a deep dark purple color with ruby edges and a medium/large dark pink head. Aroma is tangy fruity tart with loads of tart blueberries and red berry skin, lemon juice, light bitter vanilla and more tart cherry-like acidity. Light funk. Taste is also big on the fruit and acidic tones, with light funk and a closing lingering bitterness. More blueberries and red berry skin. Medium bodied with lively carbonation. Overall, very tasty but I would have preferred the raspberries to shine more and the bitterness to be toned down.

Draught at Himmeriget. Deep purple liquid with medium pink head. Aroma of raspberries, lemon, apple skin, blueberries, mineral, light funk and red apple. Taste is light sweet and medium sour with notes of blueberries, lemon and red apple. Wow. Fantastic. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Great stuff. Taste is so complex and fruity.

Thx to Sebletitje for picking up a ticket. This event seems to be getting more & more crowded every year. Draft glass @ Moeder Lambic Fontainas. Looks ridiculously pretty. Deep bright pink / red / blueberry juice with a huge super bright pink head. Nose is faintly grainy upfront, faintly metallic, red fruit, blueberry bit upfront, low vanilla, red wine, quite messy, parts don¬ít seem to blend, bit empty. Body is faintly empty, bit empty fruit, raspberry, forest berries, lemon, vanilla barely there, quite messy, doesn¬ít entirely jell, puckering, red wine. Body is bit empty vaguely metallic, lightly puckering. On its own this is a very good beer but I had higher expectation, not my favourite Cantillon but the bar being far too crowded for me might have adversely influenced my opinion.

Tap @ Himmeriget, Copenhagen. Pours deep reddish with a white head. Juicy and intense marmelade like jammy raspberries and blueberries. Little Cantillon funk. Woody and dry. A fine tasty glass of beer - but would prefer gambrinus anyday!
Draft at Zwanze Day - Monk¬ís. Pours clear red pink head - nose/taste of raspberry, oak, funk, blueberry and light vanilla sweetness. The vanilla balances out the acidity - medium body.

Bright dark red, almost purple. Aroma is jammy rasberries, barnyard, blueberries and a decent vanilla presence. Very fruity with a moderate lambic sourness although it remains soft per Cantillon standards - vanilla (and maybe blueberry) playing a more important role than expected. My preference for softer fruit lambic had a positive impact on my rating. One of the good Zwanze.

Je dois ce verre √† Guillaume Sigouin, un ami que je ne serais suffisamment remercier. Cheers mon vieux! Le liquide est tr√®s fonc√© et pourrait facilement passer pkur une bi√®re au cassis. Translucide. Ce n¬íest pas la confiture de framboises √† laquelle je m¬íattendais. Un beau funk au nez qui laisse le fuut sur sa soif, faute d¬íun bois vanill√© encombrant. Non pas que l¬íensemble soit surpuissant, bien au contraire. C¬íest d√©licat. M√™me ce funk √† tendance Cantillonnais est tr√®s d√©licat. En bouche, le fruit prend des allures de confiture et comme le disent √† raison les Marc-Andr√©, de Jello au fruit. La vanille a beau se r√©sorber au rythme de la temp√©rature, le tout demeure, √† mon avis, bien moins int√©ressant que la Ros√© de Gambrinus.

Rating #6000! 5 oz pour on draft at The Sovereign for Zwanze Day 2016. Clear ruby red with light pink head. Aromas of berries and funk. Tastes of berries, light vanilla, tart acidic notes. Medium-light body with a dry finish. Nice lambic, nothing over the top.

UPDATED: OCT 2, 2016 Purplish red body, thin pinkish head, spotty lacing. Jammy raspberry with some earthy, slightly astringent (blue)berry and vanilla bean notes. Medium bodied, moderate carbonation, mild sweetness and moderate acidity, not much funk. Flavorful, if not young and not very complex at this stage.
Very nice. Vanilla ice cream cones and raspberries. Everything to love here. Jean did a great job on this one.

Keg at The Kernel, as ¬íCantillon Zwanze 2016 Framboise¬í, 5%. Opaque purple, foamy pink head, dotted lacing. Aroma is jam tart, Ribena, blackcurrant. Body is light, spritzy carbonation, slightly foamy. Taste is strawberry juice up front, vanilla, blueberry, blackcurrant and lots of Ribena in the finish. Tasty stuff. Fruity, but doesn¬ít have the complexity that makes some in the style stand out. Still, very good.

Keg at six degrees north edinburgh. Pours deep ruby, nose is funky raspberry, burnt toffee, vanilla, taste is tart, juicy raspberry, vanilla, light blueberry. surprising amount of vanilla coming through.
UPDATED: OCT 5, 2016 Tap @ himmeriget copenhagen. Pours a redish colour beer with a medium head. Fruity and bretty with rasberries also some notes of blueberries, wood and vanilla. Dry finish.

UPDATED: OCT 2, 2016 Draught at Akkurat, Zwanze 2016.
Yaaay my 1000th rating here!
Clear dark ruby red, short pinkish head.
Lots of fresh lingon and cranberries with some raspberries beneath. Some funk, but fresh fruits and berries is the main thing.
Taste is thick berries like lingon and cranberries, almonds and dry wood.
Dry fairly light mouthfeel with soft carbonation.
Pretty good, but too much lingon and shit. The small glass didn¬ít do it justice. It grew in a slightly bigger glass.
On tap at Scheras for Zwanze day. Dark raspberry pour with nice pink head. Really tart raspberry aroma. Starts easy and builds, blueberry comes through in the middle. Very well done!

Aroma: Tart Pie Cherry, Mild Raspberry, Mild Vanilla...
Appearance: Ruby Hue, Passes Some Light, Purple Head, Some Lacing...
Taste: Raspberries, Tart Cherry, Minimal Vanilla...
Mouthfeel: Decent Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Mildly Tart, Mildly Drying

On keg in Kernel. Slight haze, deep rich purple red with a large soft white head which dissipates to thin. Nose is musty fruit, pretty big sour and and sour. Raspberry fruit, cherry, funk and marzipan. Taste is big tart and sour, hard to pick out the fruit but there¬ís some raspberry, slight cherry, crisp minerals.

Pour a deep ruby red, with a very small slightly pink - white head. 
Aroma of raspberries, slight Marcipan cherries, slight blueberries, faint vanilla, lactic, almonds. Pretty darn juicy and sour candy like. 
Taste is rather sour, with faint vanilla and berry sweetness. 
Medium bodied, with a really fizzy carb.

Keg at Kernel. It pours rich cloudy dark purple with a medium light purple head. The aroma is fresh, very juicy, vibrant, jammy, raspberry, blueberry, Victoria sponge and candy. The taste is crisp, dry, tart, very juicy, raspberry, blueberry, lemon rind, granny smith apple, dry wood, with a dry, juicy finish. Medium + body and moderate carbonation. Not a huge amount of depth, just crazy juicy and quaffable.

Tap @ himmeriget. Pours deep red with a pink head. Aroma of fresh raspberries, vanilla, some cheese, funky notes beneath, slight strawberry jam and slight oak. Taste of raspberries, oak, funk, tart red currants, slight Blueberry, leather, slight vanilla and citrus.

On tap @ DDC. Pour bright ruby red/purple-ish with a nice pink head and little lacing. Aroma of fresh raspberries, lots of vanilla and a bit of cherries. It has a nice sourness and the vanilla brings an interesting sweet note. More of a sipper than regular cantillons but still refreshing. Very good.

From tap at Himmeriget. Rating number 1700!! Pours a Dark, hazy, ruby red with a small pink head. Aroma has so much fresh berries with vanilla. Reminds me of boiling jam or juice! Light funk, but mostly fresh rasberry, blueberry, strawberry and rhubarb. Taste is sour. Very prominent vanilla spice, pithy raspberry bitterness. Super juicy, not super complex. Would be interesting to try this in a couple of years! AVG carb, juicy body.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma starts out with sharp fresh berries. Cherry to almost raspberry aroma. Flavor starts out moderately strong tartness with dark and tart cherries after the swallow. Aftertaste remains tart, crisp and dry.

Draft at playalinda at Zwanze day. Nose is moderate to high in fruity berry. Moderate tartness in aroma. Dark red pour. Dark pink head. Initially very tart with modest fruitiness. Not picking up vanilla. Not getting much blueberry either. Kinda just tastes like the kriek with a slight mellowness to it. Decent.

Keg at kernel at the Zwanze. A beautiful deep purple red plum coloured pour with a lasting G sticky deep pink head. Aroma is jammy dark fruits, sour, raspberry, Blueberry, tart lacto, rubber. Flavour is composed of cherry, tart berry, raspberry, blackberry, blueberry, jammy fruits, Tangy berry fruits. Palate is little tangy acid, highish carbonation, spritzy . Lovely complex fruits, drying finish.

UPDATED: OCT 1, 2016 On draft at Avenue Pub. Pours dark purple with no head. raspberry nose. Blueberry forward flavor with a slight hint of vanilla on the finish. Kind of dry. Medium mouthfeel average carb. Easily the best zwanze beer I?ve had

On tap at Avenue Pub. Pours a cloudy purple with medium pink head that lasts. The aroma is strong berries, funk, vanilla, oak. Medium body, nice funk, berries, vanilla comes out more as it warms, nice tartness, really enjoyed this.

Glass at Zwanze day, Amsterdam (Butcher¬ís Tears). Cloudy purple with a pink head. Aroma of big fresh raspberry, tart blueberry and vanilla just hinting behind. Flavour is light sweet and moderate sour. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

On tap at JK Zwanze day... Brilliant purple pour... Aroma of juicy raspberries, blueberries, hint of vanilla... Mouthfeel is effervescent, tons of juicy raspberries, some blueberry and vanilla notes, finish is fresh raspberries... Delicious 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Himmeriget, Copenhagen. Pours a clear ruby with a small light pink head. Tart and dry with aromas of sour cherries, blueberries  and forest berries. Hints of metals. Medium to light bodied. Medium to soft carbonation. Dry and tart finish with more cherries and blueberries.

On tap at Playalinda for Zwanze Day. Deep garnet pour with a pink head. Tart berry bouquet. Muddled mixed up sour berry notes dominate. I don¬ít really get the vanilla and the barrel characteristics are somewhat muted. Good body and mouthfeel.

Aroma of blueberries, raspberries, lemon and funk. Flavor is sour and fruity with some lemon, blueberries, raspberries and funk. Medium body, average carbonation.
Tap @ Himmeriget. Clear red body with body small head. Vanilla bean, fruity, tart, blueberry. Light vinegar. Great.
Some raspberry and some grapefruit peel. Poura ruby red with hot pink head. Quite tangy. Lots of Rosee de Gambrinus here. Tangy finish. Tap at Sovereign big thanks to Kevin and John.

Tap into a tulip showing lightly filtered and red wine with sparse white foam. 

The nose shows a mix of berries - raspberries, blueberries, and boysenberry. Light oak in the background. 

The palate is medium bodied and moderately carbonated. Highly tart with flavors of light raspberries and very light blueberries. Lightly tannic on the finish.

Deep red with a nice pink head. Aroma is raspberry, blueberry, sour forest fruits. Light bodied, tart on the palate with a long dry finish. Taste is raspberries, hint of blueberry, red wine vinegar. Nice.
Intense blueberry, hint of raspberry, vanilla. Aroma is intense and complex. Nice well balanced as cantillon always is. Nice with sweet berry desert

Draught @ Himmeriget. Hazy red with slight pinkish head. Blueberry and raspberry aroma with hints of barnyard, sweaty horses,, apples, citrus and vanilla. Sweet and tart raspberry flavour with blueberry, vanilla and wood ending in a subtle bitterness.
Tap himmeriget zwanze. Pours cloudy reddish with a white head. Aroma of raspberry, fruity, light black currents, slight sweet. Taste is fruity, raspberry, light vanilla, light rubber, quite tart.

Keg at Himmeriget. Hazy deep red with a medium sized off white head. Raspberry, vanilla, wood, light pepper/gunpowder, black berries. Light leather and rubber. Lingering raspberry and vanilla. Light bodied, prickling carbonation, little sweetness, medium sour. Feels a bit thin and fizzy compared to other Cantillon offerings.

Draught at Himmeriget, Copenhagen. Hazy reddish/ruby beer with a nice pinkish head. Sourish raspberry aroma, fruity, tart, wild strawberries, rubber notes, floral, tiny blueberries. Tart raspberry and blueberry flavor, wild strawberries, funky, dry, some cherry seeds. Great!

Keg @ Akkurat during the Zwanze dinner. Pours hazy deep ruby red with a frothy bluish pinkish white head that leaves some sparse spotty trace on the glass while dissipating. Smell is heavy fruity with crackers, raspberries, blackberries, billberries, hay, dry soil, leather, barnyard, vanilla and lemon zest. Taste is heavy sour, tiny bitter, heavy fruity, slightly earthy and tiny funky. Mouthfeel is dry, tart, slightly astringent and light to medium bodied. Finish is sour with crackers, lemon juice, raspberries, bilberries, vanilla beans, moist soil, dry wood, barnyard and lemon zest. Amazing smell on this one with fresh raspberries, wild forest berries, bilberries and vanilla. Light funk but pretty much all fruit and vanilla. In a way a dumbed down lambic with all the brett complexity lost but as a fruited sour its great and the nose is just insane.

On tap at Zwanze Day 2016 at Butcher¬ís Tears. Semi-hazy ruby pour with a pink head. Notes of raspberries, minerals, lambic funk, horse blanket, bitter cherries, vanilla, oak. Medium body and carbonation and a light tart and refreshing finish.
Draft. Dark purple pour with pink head. Raspberries, other berries, funk, wine, and oak aromas. Flavors are funky, raspberries, other tart fruit, vanilla and berry tones.

UPDATED: OCT 2, 2016 Draught at Tribaun, Innsbruck. 
Beautiful deep ruby body, with a big, creamy, lacing, pink head.
Lovely dense, fruity aroma of raspberries, blueberries, medium funk, young cheese, red apples, subtle vanilla. 
Taste follows this, a bit more funky and medium dry, with pears and some horse blanket.
Medium, oily mouthfeel, with a lively carbonation.
Finishes medium sour, medium dry, fruity, with wild berries, pears, apples, some funk.

Delicious! Not as acidic as other Cantillons I¬íve had, very fruity and fresh, with lovely sweet-sour berries dominating, yet also very complex. Really well balanced, with just the right level of sourness for my taste. I think this is my favourite Cantillon so far, had to order another two pours of this. :-)

Aroma and taste is resonating berry fruity with notes of raspberry and blueberry, tart fruity finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draught at Akkurat. 
Pours clear red. 
Aroma of blueberry and vanilla. 
Balanced as all cantillon, lots of blueberries and some raspberry seeds.

UPDATED: OCT 3, 2016 Tap at Erzbierschof Zurich. Strawberries and vanilla, yes. Blueberry opens with temperature and time. Fruity, crisp, light, but with full taste. Vanilla doesn¬ít work so well and makes it sweeter than it should, but that is mediated by temperature again. Medium berry finish. Very nice.

UPDATED: OCT 1, 2016 Colore rosso scuro, schiuma rosata di media persistenza. Aroma di lievito, acidula e abbastanza puzzosa. Al palato acida, con frutta in particolare lampone, fragola, frutti di bosco. Continua fortemente acida e con sentori di vaniglia. Carbonazione elevata. Non √® male ma un po? piaciona.

At akkurat 
Red balck clear, light pink head
Aroma of berries, blueberry vanilla
Taste slight sour, clear taste of vanilla. Blueberry.
Nice and balanced.

UPDATED: NOV 5, 2016 Tap at Erzbierschof. Hazy purple color with pink head. Aroma is vanilla, raspberry, some blueberry. Taste is raspberry, some vanilla, quite dry. Medium carbonation. Long aftertaste with lots of fruits. Very good, but I am not completely overwhelmed.As it warms up, it obtains more beautiful dark blueberry and vanilla notes come in there, it?s very complex!
From the bottle, one month later - it¬ís a bit less abbrassive, more mellow. Very good.
UPDATED: OCT 2, 2016 Pours cranberry juice in color thin pink around the rim lacing. The aroma is raspberry, cough syrup, floral notes and vinegar

(Keg at Stadin Panimobaari, 20161001) The beer poured deep ruby red and clear. Its head was pink and small. Aroma had raspberries, vanilla, bilberries and tartness. Palate was medium bodied and dryish with medium carbonation. Flavours were tartness, sourness, raspberries, bilberries, vanilla and low bitterness. Aftertaste had tartness, bilberries and low bitterness. A pleasant soft lambic. Good balance.

Draught @ Stadin panimobaari. 
Poured deep red color with a thin pink head. 
Aroma has blueberries, barnyard, tartness. 
Flavor has red berries, blackcurrant, sourness, raspberries. Complex, dry finish. Lovely.
Draught @ Stadin Panimobaari. Aroma has tart raspberries and earthy notes. Flavour has raspberries, grapefruit, earthy notes and berry juice. A mellow version of Cambrinus. Balanced.
Tap at Stadin Panimobaari, Helsinki. Colour is deep ruby with small pinkish white head. Aromas and flavors: Berries, red berries, blue berries, vineous elements, dryness and sourness. Extremely dry.

Draught at Stadin Panimo. Ruby color, pink head. Sour taste with cherry, berries, wheat, tart, grass and a bit of acidic notes. Sour finish with cherry, berries, wheat, tart and grass. Exquisite sour.

UPDATED: OCT 1, 2016 Draught on Zwanze Day 2016 @ Stadin Panimobaari, Helsinki, Finland. Pours deep dark red with a smooth white head. Aroma of tart raspberries, blueberries, sourness, funky yeast, vanilla and oak. Taste is smooth, tartish and heavy with berry notes, funky farmyardy sourness and vanilla. Finish is sourish and funky with some vanilla, blueberries, raspberries and farmyard. Pretty smooth, not very aggressive. Good one.
